metadata.bijbeltekst: Genesis 37 (Joseph), Psalm 85, Matthew 14 (Peter on the water)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'News' (Gospel) breaks into the 'Status Quo' (Maintenance) to transform the human condition from anxiety/violence to joy/freedom.

subject.identificatie: The News / The Gospel (often personified as Dream, Poem, or Presence)
tekstueel_bewijs: the news that works on our status quo maintenance
the dream persists and will have its say
the Gospel news that breaks open every status quo
new God-given gift, demand, and risk
invites us to new God-given gift
takes us all to its bosom
Babette... serves a feast of extravagance

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Maintainers' / Human Anxiety / The Status Quo
tekstueel_bewijs: dream-killers in the interest of the status quo
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a 'kiss of death' and a systemic resistance to God's kingdom.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church meeting to renounce old habits and re-engage the news.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / We
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/church life) is presented as the response to the primary program (the news breaking in).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The News → Breaking the Status Quo

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We maintain by writing careful memos

voorbeelden: we rather like the way things are
none of them knew that at the time
Jesus is more powerful than the surging sea

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of the News to overcome the 'Power' of the Status Quo. It is an ontological struggle between two capacities.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Maintenance) through ~S1 (Memos/Anxiety) toward S1 (The News/Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The News is an 'un-killable' force that persists despite human resistance.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; S2 is described as a 'kiss of death'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While human subjects are frequent, they are primarily subjects of 'resistance' or 'failure.' God/The News is the subject of transformative power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The first paragraph is entirely about 'We maintain.'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Grace makes no conditions and singles out none of us in particular.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the actor in the 'News'
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The dream comes from God... you cannot kill the dream.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as actants in a cosmic drama rather than moral examples to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Joseph is a vehicle for God's intention; Peter is a foil for Jesus' power.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'maintenance' and anxiety.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic transformation: the News does the work that the hearer cannot.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The three biblical texts are tightly woven into a single actantial struggle between Maintenance and News.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Grace demands nothing' and the call to 'renounce violence'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has mastered the chaos and tamed the storm.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'News' itself functions as the endowment of power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a systemic 'Status Quo' of anxiety and violence that 'kills dreams'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God/The Gospel as the active Subject and the human as the resistant but ultimately rescued Receiver.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too much with the 'Maintainer' and feel judged.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'General Amnesty' quote more to move the hearer from 'Maintainer' to 'Guest'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: High Devoir in the final section (renouncing habits).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Instead of 'We meet to renounce,' use 'The News enables us to let go.'

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as 'The Kiss of Death'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The current structure (Soteriology of the News leading to the Ethics of the Church) is correct.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses structural tension to highlight the power of the Gospel over human anxiety.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Maintenance/News' alliteration; Greimas shows the underlying power struggle between actants.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look at the historical context of Joseph; Greimas looks at Joseph's functional role as a 'Dreamer' sent by God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Anxiety' is not just a feeling but a functional 'Opponent' actant blocking the Subject (The News).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the Babette's Feast quote as a 'theological anchor' to ensure the actantial Subject remains Grace.
